# The `scc_iterator` Class Template Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Enumerate the SCCs of a directed graph in reverse topological order of the SCC DAG. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

Enumerate the SCCs of a directed graph in reverse topological order of the SCC DAG.

This is implemented using Tarjan&#39;s DFS algorithm using an internal stack to build up a vector of nodes in a particular SCC. Note that it is a forward iterator and thus you cannot backtrack or re-visit nodes.

Definition at line 47 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/scciterator-h">SCCIterator.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### hasCycle() {#abbd6357648d228d6a6e32e00aa2a5794}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class GraphT, class GT = GraphTraits&lt;GraphT&gt;&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>bool llvm::scc&#95;iterator&lt; GraphT, GT &gt;::hasCycle () const</>}>
Test if the current SCC has a cycle.

If the SCC has more than one node, this is trivially true. If not, it may still contain a cycle if the node has an edge back to itself.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/scciterator-h/#l00136">136</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/scciterator-h">SCCIterator.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### visitNum {#a96a9b2e4b5d1793376a671eee9b35b46}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class GraphT, class GT = GraphTraits&lt;GraphT&gt;&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>unsigned llvm::scc&#95;iterator&lt; GraphT, GT &gt;::visitNum</>}>
The visit counters used to detect when a complete SCC is on the stack.

visitNum is the global counter.

nodeVisitNumbers are per-node visit numbers, also used as DFS flags.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/scciterator-h/#l00075">75</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/scciterator-h">SCCIterator.h</a>.

### VisitStack {#ae535709f92b3c85a7add89cc3397f384}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class GraphT, class GT = GraphTraits&lt;GraphT&gt;&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>std::vector&lt;StackElement&gt; llvm::scc&#95;iterator&lt; GraphT, GT &gt;::VisitStack</>}>
DFS stack, Used to maintain the ordering.

The top contains the current node, the next child to visit, and the minimum uplink value of all child
